meanings.definition: The bluish-purple discoloration of the skin after death.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the body and noted the livor on the deceased's skin.
meanings.sent2: The livor on the corpse's skin indicated the time since death.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled, 'Looks like the livor is giving us a clue about the crime scene.'
meanings.sent4: The livor on the skin painted a grim picture of the person's final moments.
meanings.sent5: The livor on the skin was a haunting reminder of mortality.

meanings.definition: The settling of blood in the lower parts of the body after death.
meanings.sent1: The mortician observed the livor in the deceased's limbs.
meanings.sent2: Lividity, or livor, is a common occurrence in bodies after death.
meanings.sent3: The livor in the legs made the corpse look like it was doing a strange dance.
meanings.sent4: The livor in the lower body was a silent witness to the person's passing.
meanings.sent5: The livor in the limbs added a touch of sadness to the scene.
